creator: raytan262

title: Restore Previous Session not working - or, not properly at least
content:
OK, I was using a very old version of firefox previously and restore previous session worked perfectly. If my computer crashed, when I rebooted it, the "trouble finding pages" message came up, click to restore session, and everything came back.

Then.... I upgraded to version 72.0.2 (64 bit)

Session restore no longer works, or at least not the way it should be working.

If I had say 20 windows open when the computer crashed, when I finish a reboot and start Firefox, I get the "trouble finding pages" message, and I click to restore session as before.

Anywhere from 2 to maybe 5 windows will restore. The rest are gone.

I suspect it has to do with the fact that there were now multiple "instances" of firefox running in the task manager, and what's happening is that it's restoring the windows in ONE of those previous instances, but not all of them.

It gives me the impression that the session restore function isn't tracking all the windows open in all those separate instances, but rather it's only tracking one instance.


Any assistance would be appreciated.
creator: magelord

title: Atualização automática de página em loop e Shift abrindo Desenvolvimento Web
content:
Há anos tenho dois problemas com o Firefox: 1- Quando entro em alguns site (inclusive no site Mozilla) o browser entra em loop na atualização automática da página. Algumas vezes, quando teclo "Esc" ele interrompe por alguns segundos e depois volta para o loop. E então não consigo acessar nada. (não tenho fotos, apenas vídeo disso). 2- O outro problema é quando preciso usar a tecla "Shift" para digitar algo em caixa alta. Ele sozinho abre uma janela na parte de baixo do browser semelhante às janelas de ferramentas de "Desenvolvimento Web".

Utilizo Firefox há mais de dez anos. E de alguns anos para cá começaram estes problemas. Já atualizei, já reinstalei, já formatei e reinstalei e o problema persiste. E esses problemas acontecem em 50% das vezes que utilizo o browser, me obrigando a utilizar outro browser naquele momento. Neste momento, por exemplo, está acontecendo isso. Então para eu conseguir enviar estas perguntas, estou enviando por outro navegador.

O que devo fazer para solucionar isso? (Pois realmente não gosto de usar Chrome nem Edge)
creator: furlanfilho

title: Printing Problem: Reader View Renumbers List
content:
I'm finding the new Reader View often helpful in printing web pages.

However, I've found one problem: I printed a web page with a numbered list (1,2,3), with many of the numbered paragraphs having sub-paragraphs that were lettered (a,b,c). But Reader View converted the letters for all the sub-paragraphs into numbers. And, although the sub-paragraphs were at least indented on the screen, they all printed at the margin with the numbered items.

So I end up with something that's hard to follow because the printed text is numbered: 1 1 (for a) 2 (for b) 3 (for c) 2 1 (for a) ... and so on

Here's a link to the page that produced the hard-to-follow printed text. Look at it with Reader View, and then print it (it's only a few sheets), and the problem is obvious: https://support.killernetworking.com/knowledge-base/clean-install-killer-control-center/

creator: taherte

title: "Save to PDF" creates PDF rendered as images
content:
Just tried out "Save to PDF" feature under the Print function. It seems Firefox 86.0 is using cairo 1.9.5 to generate the PDF. The result is a much larger file that loses the ability to select texts in the document.

Even if the original document is a PDF file (e.g. Lorem_Ipsum.pdf), Chrome (and Edge) both use PDFium as the generator and create a 22.67KB PDF document. Firefox on the other hand, creates a 652.17KB PDF document with no text selection capability.

I don't know whether to pose this as question to see if anyone else experiences the same issue, or to report it as a bug/improvement request.
creator: nanakinoir

title: Closing a new tab closes firefox
content:
I recently "refreshed" Firefox to solve a printer problem and that worked. But, now I'm having a problem with tabs. Prior to the "refresh" I kept 8-9 tabs always open and they ran across the top of the page with a "new tab" at the right end of the string. I could open a new tab, keep it open, and close it. Now, the new tab is at the upper left and when I search for a new site and open a tab that tab stays at the upper left. When I close that new tab, Firefox closes and I have to start all over again. My standard pages load but I must sign in to every page.

What do I need to do to get the "new tab" to the right of my standard string of tabs and be able to close that new tab without Firefox closing down and forcing me start all over.

I'm running Win 10 on an HP laptop.

Thanks

content: We've encountered various sites that will not work with Firefox. If we switch to Chrome the usually will work. Two examples: 1) We use LogMeIn remote access to log into our network remotely. USPS says to use another browser which also means we need to create another account as FF didn't save any of the log-in info even tho' it's configured to do so. In Chrome and Edge, I can add an extra web page with the following urls - chrome://settings/help or edge://settings/help

I don't want to wait until Firefox automatically decides it is time to check and update the software. I have many computers and I don't want to spend time waiting for it.

Thank you for any help.

title: Firefox (Windows) "save to.."-window always as full screen, can't be resized
content:
Hey there,

whenever I save files (be it PDFs or images) from Firefox to my hard drive, the pop up window where I select the location where to save the file is displayed as full screen. While I can still use the window to save the file, it always covers the source in the background, from which I often want to copy information into the file's name. So I have to cancel the process, copy the information, then save the file.

In the past the "save to.."-window was resizeable, you could easily drag its right lower corner. But somehow that function isn't working anymore..? Even though the corner is marked as resizable by the typical triangle of grey dots, clicking and dragging it doesn't do anything.

Even when the Firefox browser window only takes up half the space of my monitor besides another programme's window, the "save to"-window covers the whole view height und and width.

How can I get the window to be smaller?

Thanks in advance! English isn't my first language, so please excuse any weird wording.

Firefox-Version 86.0 (64-Bit), Windows 10
creator: vivien.nun

title: Website Access Denial
content:
There are websites that can’t be fully accessed unless ad blocking is disabled. For those sites, I not only have Ad Blocker Plus turned off, but also have exempted them from Firefox’s enhanced tracking protection. Yet, I can’t get in. This denial only happens with Mozilla Firefox. If I copy and paste the website’s URL from Firefox into Google Chrome and/or Microsoft Edge (where ad blocking is also turned off), I gain full access.

Firefox tells me it is up to date (March 11, 2021), version 86.0 (64-bit). Is there some Firefox setting--other than enhanced tracking--that needs to be tweaked so I don't have to switch between browsers?

title: How to simultaneously run and easily distinguish different FireFox Profiles on Mac OS X?
content:
I am relatively new to FireFox, so I might be missing the obvious, but here's what I'm (unsuccessfully so far) trying to accomplish: To run different Firefox profiles (each on a separate IP address) simultaneously on my Mac and be easily able to tell the different profiles apart through a little icon, or whatever. I thought I hit pay dirt when I found the following article, but it's from 2008 and I cannot get it to work: https://spf13.com/post/managing-multiple-firefox-profiles-in-os-x/

For one, it tells me that I already have an instance of FireFox and cannot have another, when I try to open more than one profile. Secondly, I cannot figure out which profile is which (for example Chrome Users have little icons, so you can easily tell which one you're looking at). I read through the Profile Manager article, but didn't find the answers I was looking for. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

It's very frustating, i just want to go the the goddamn page i asked, not a reformatted on.

creator: arnold187

title: Can't login to anthing Google
content:
OS: macOS Big Sur, version 11.2.3 Firefox: Latest Version

I was able to login to all my Google locations (mail, photos, calendar, etc) without a problem on Monday. Apple replaced the Logic Board on Tuesday. Since then, I have not been able to login to anything Google. I have cleared cache, erased history, cookies, etc. Started and Stopped Firefox and still I can not login.

Firefox puts up a Login Window for the Google location and I add the UserId, but when I use the 'Next' button, nothing happens. There is no spinning 'Wait' signal or anything else. The CPU does not spin. The tab just quietly sits there.

I uninstalled Firefox and reinstalled it. No luck.

The Google locations do work on the other browsers (Safari and Chrome) so I have a subpar workaround.

Summary of trials: 1) The network is working because I can use the other browsers to get to Google Locations 2) OS is not a problem, since the OS was installed from the Monday Night Backup and the other Browsers work 3) I have made sure the Mac Security Preferences allow Firefox in the "Privacy->Accessibility" settings

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
creator: NickAtNight

title: Releasing right-click in right-click menu acts like a left click.
content: The issue was brought up in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1180792 (which I'm also experiencing), but the root problem was completely side-stepped. If, somehow, this was done on purpose, the decision to do so was a very very bad one: no user ever expects right-click interactions to actually perform any actions without left-click-based confirmation, and it adds friction to the “right-click and find out” mentality that aids learning of unfamiliar software.
creator: atimholt
